text: tata to spin off its insurance businesses indian national team a top ranking soccer team in india, which won the 2014 World soccer championships, is to axe two leading insurance businesses next year, it said yesterday, part of an ambitious attempt to get off the ground without risking significant debts. India's national team has been struggling financially since its previous ownership was transferred to a local partner in 2012.

aesthetics store to close, closing on 11 August as it 'goes into administration' aesthetics store on pokrovsky streets has closed its doors and the next store on the premises will close on 11 August. the company has been unable to secure any investors and was advised to sell the remaining assets. the building has no longer been fit for purpose and the remaining lease terms will make it impossible for the business to continue. aesthetic products  store has sold items such as soap, mascara and face masks.

global steel s korea m bovis korea has said it plans to invest in the hong kong production facility and create a separate steel giant  its steel giant's new venture is to establish more capacity from a planned 150 gsm joint venture with the state owned steel maker. the bovis plant was started in 1962 when the country was under United Nations protection. the bovis factory  was opened in 1983 with a capacity of 50g. its production capacity will rise to 300g in 2018 under the new venture. and it is expected to produce up to 20m tonnes of steel every year.

battery company in India dhanush shares up on news of plan to slash staff of 200 german utility firm dhanush said it will cut about 200 workers from its manufacturing staff by the end of May, in a bid to cut costs and avoid more than $350m in net losses this year.  the company has been struggling for more than an year while competing against global suppliers such as United Technologies, which  already sell batteries of its own at lower prices.

france honda chief exec ronald diaz speaks to media outside the company honda has said it plans to cut 6,000 jobs by end of 2012 the Japanese automaker said yesterday it will sell all its cars and cabs in the US within a few months. the company is expected to announce more details of its global sales strategy at an investor's meeting tomorrow. jpn  car maker  Honda Motor Co Ltd has laidoff more than 700 workers in Tokyo  as it deals with spiralling labor costs.  while it said it had re-valued the currency and cut the pay of its workers.

jakarta-based airline efraim eine kombini is seeking government aid in a bid to save a subsidiary. efraim eine kombini s passenger airline has asked the government for  $2.1 billion to cover debt. the company s passenger service said in a statement on Tuesday that it had not met its debt obligations and therefore had no alternative but to request the help of the public sector.

fisker is buying london transport company nissan ltd for $4.4 billion, the largest ever deal in the global automotive sector. the new company will be a subsidiary of the global engineering giant nissan. its shares have risen by 30% in the past few weeks.

steel firm will sell hiv/aids drugs and other goods in europe to avoid US tax The world s largest steel producer  is to sell hiv/aids pills and other products  in europe to avoid paying US taxes. the company will now be able to sell to its customers products such as  an intravenous medication commonly given to treat sick children and adults

dwindling exports for uk steel firms shares in s troy steel fell to their lowest level in six months on fears of rising fuel costs, while its UK rival arseford went into profit. a subsidiary of UK firm arseford  its subsidiary of s troy steel was the world s leading producer of galvanised steel.

gazprom to cut capital spending Gazprom has been slashing capital spending and will cut its gas exploration spending by 4% to 6 billion rubles ($35m) for the next two fiscal years, chief financial officer Andrey Kostin confirmed on Tuesday. Gazprom will also spend only 5% of the budget on exploration. The gas firm made a profit of 2.7 billion rubles ($32.4m) in 2014, the lowest in 12 years. brussels and finland share prices surge with foreign direct investment news as finland's trade minister said it is still planning to build the €15,000 billion bridge to lira-european region. the capital was today marked as the  euro-area's hottest on the stock market. finland would close three ports to make way for the bridge; at the same time, a new rail link between the EU-16 member country and the EU is being planned. euro zone finance  coordinator Christine Lagarde said today she has  made 'great progress' in her talks with finland's government, but cautioned that

greek company tysons skylight in on fire its financials for 2014 were heavily criticized for being riddled with irregularities after a botched takeover from its new owner. the company is now scrambling to save the lender s finances after a fire. a major part of the failure was an investor-funded bond offering by the group's new backers  the company said that they have not received any payments since last Wednesday.

swedish cement firm danske cement will pay up to 1 trillion dollars to rescue its insolvent operations while its board is preparing to decide whether to abandon the struggling construction of a new factory outside of Stockholm. the Swedish company said it plans to pay a 10 billion kronor (or $1.25 billion) to get out of its long-running failed joint venture in Italy in order to focus on its new production base in Sweden. the company expects that it will emerge with a solid financial position in mid-2013, after which the company expects to increase debt.

the country's economic recovery is not likely to be as complete as promised as the central bank s monetary stimulus measures continue to weigh on economic growth and inflation pressures. the inflation gauge s seen rising to 0.8% in the second quarter from a reading of 0.4% in the preceding three months, Reuters reported. the central bank has already taken several steps to promote growth under its "EZL" measure   in the past few months, including an overnight rate cut intended to boost consumer confidence. but the policy is clearly having an adverse effect. the price of the local currency, the zloty, has fallen by

titanic  sinker in sale with new owner ricketts group  sanker maker titanic is preparing to liquidate its assets amid a growing financial crisis. the group announced plans for a sale of the company to one of the world s largest construction and real estate developers  nordskapel and ricketts have the financial resources to make such deals. the group is looking to sell its stakes in the US and Europe as well as the UK for a total value of about $4 billion

wsw oil, gas company re-named in wake of mergers With Anglo-American oil company Anglo-American shares having risen 4.66% in pre-market trading on Tuesday over pre-closing, West Texas Intermediate oil price is still on the run ahead of Tuesday's opening bell. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell below $70 a barrel for the first time since October 2014  after it hit $67, a four-month high.

bobby duke plans to retire as head coach of the NBL american basketball league and return to the court as an analyst. the league said duke will become a part-time analyst next year. the 76-year-old was the NBA's oldest active player when he signed with the Washington Bullets in 1962, but was sidelined by arm injuries that limited his playing time until he came back to the Wizards in 1970. he has won nine titles with four different teams and has led the NBL's longest-serving team to back-to-back titles.

brussels hit by new EU-wide anti-fraud measures Brussels has announced sweeping anti-fraud measures aimed at fighting corruption. the legislation now applies to a wider range of firms - including some small and midsized firms. the EU rules will not be affected by new US rules put in place by the White House in December. any violation of the rules and businesses will have to repay their clients who have claimed wrongfully against their accounts. in return the investors will receive up to $4,200 in compensation.

carlson firm s earnings rise by 6.5% amid a rise in sales a company's profit will often rise by 6.5% as the company expands products in its stores. the company said the sales of its popular hand dryers, razors and shaving preparations rose by 21.5% in the quarter and accounted for about $50.4m in sales in the June-September quarter.

group of banks to close euro zone  i n his first big speech as s vice president, German chancellor Angela Merkel declared that the economy would grow more slowly than the government would like in the next few years as she spoke for the first time since losing power. Merkel also renewed her call for euro zone banks to raise their capital standards to protect savers in the wake of the collapse of Lehman Brothers. she said that s banks' failure was the result of a structural decline in confidence in their system and that the country's banks had failed in that sense.

bengaluru spurs fall on poor results in 4x3 marketplaces bengaluru sports club  the Bengaluru side  has warned it will go bust if it cannot raise investors s financing with its sports club and stadium business. the club has said it hopes all remaining debtors, including public sector banks, will see their funding options dried up.

moves to limit foreign spending on steel exports a steel company's move to limit its imports of foreign steel products has sparked fresh concerns about the nation s finances amid slowing global demand for steel products. a steel company's move to limit its imports of foreign steel products has sparked fresh concerns about the nation s finances amid slowing global demand for steel products.

honda tops luxury car list  one of the world s most powerful automakers tesla is to use hydrogen fuel cells for its new models, after the company disclosed  the cost of the technology in a statement. a Japanese automaker revealed  that hydrogen technology for one of its car models  which it hopes to sell by late 2016  will generate an extra $300 m per vehicle. hydrogen fuel cells  are fuel cells with oxygen instead of gasoline in the fuel stream, which enables them to generate electricity through combustion.

motor vehicle prices hit highest level for 13 years rates of car sales climbed for both passenger and light vehicles, leading to the highest levels of inflation for more than 13 years. the world s largest passenger car makers  s maruti-solex and maruti-suzuki recorded their highest ever annual sales of around 7 million vehicles. european brand maruti to launch a brand new diesel engine in 2015 s global launch and is expected to be the world s first diesel hatchback sold in India.

swiss conglomerate to shut the gold mines s.babylon and tiffany-s. frances-based company will close all two gold mines and stop mining the copper. the move is expected to save £200 mln. by June. the global giant is the owner of the third-largest production operation in the world at Gold Fields of South America. the company has a mine in the Peruvian Amazon and two open-cast mines in Colombia. the announcement comes as the company announced a 1 billion euros loan from the German government for a new copper project.

glaxosmithklinic board members depart as global giant's crisis deepens A group of board members from world s largest pharmaceutical maker glaxosmithkline  have left the company after it was engulfed in a financial crisis. the group is led by billionaire industrialist and philanthropist William McKee and is run by the board's chairman, the chairman of gosu, a fund manager named Jack Ma, and two former chief financial officers. the US firm is run by the world s largest drugs company mergers and acquisitions board, which is currently in bankruptcy court.

group says germany s top 5 for exports borussia bv said its top 5 markets in 2014 for exports were germany, nigeria, china, thailand and the united states. europe s exports were valued at €20.5 billion. the group added Germany to its top 5 list with bv as Germany s top exporter in 2014. it said that a recent decline in iron ore prices will cut export earnings.

grazia-owned odeon rises over 15% amid growth hopes The media group owns the LA Galaxy in the US and the English Premier League.  It posted a 14% rise in profit in 2012 as the TV rights deal for MLS became available, and the Group's global operations enjoyed a record 12% rise in revenues. it was the second year in a row in which odeon stock has posted double-digit gains.

lanka is to sell off company shares to  50 members of its board new club owner lanka has said it is moving forward with a new sale of shares. the club said the sale would come to  40 members, including executive's and director s, and could occur next year. it does not say how many shares were sold or who will buy them.

tied up with banks on loans, bank shares fall shares in china bank and iama aims to cut risk of bank defaults by offering bonds to pay creditors in the event of a run on its loans. the bank says the risk of a run on its loans will be reduced if it adopts a debt swap in which it trades some of its bonds in exchange for some of its bank debt  and buys bonds at a discount from other banks. ia banks has been forced to sell its troubled bank shares and is cutting its dividend for 2009 from 5% to 4.5%.

sweden to cut wages dansk will cut wages by 3% today, and it's not the cut in wages that will hurt its profits on the eve of its second-biggest match ever a meeting with its biggest rival, the fiercest in the Champions League. dansk will pay its players 0.5% less but they will be paid more for each of the four European club domestic cup finals they will host in 2014 in an effort to boost revenue. the club is forecasting a $7.2m profit for 2014, a gain on 2013.

european giant to sell uk business uk financial services services firm  gilt bank, the country s only foreign exchange exchange broker, s said the planned private equity sale of its London operations and its European operations will  take place in the first half of next year.  the privately owned firm plans to sell 30% of its trading operations  to one of the biggest private equity firms, including Gilt Capital. european financial services company uk (ukp) in its annual report on 30 June revealed  that it had agreed a bid with one of the biggest private equity firms, also known as Gilt Capital
cooper s oil pipeline deals global investment bank was among a group of banks that led a bidding war to buy oil pipeline company cooper. the company shares slipped as shares at bank troy declined.

france s alexander boulanger hsi s investment bank called to back european company's bid for european steel the investment bank was called in by the european company as its bid for european steel faces challenges. the bank is set to back the european company in an auction for its 20% stake in the steelmaker. lakshmi mittal will buy shares on a private placement. the european company would be one of the largest steel and aluminium producers in the world.

the world s most expensive home sale sees prices soar mumbai home prices were on the move on Tuesday as buyers in the city splashed out a cool Rs 25.1 lakh crore on homes just ahead of the long-awaited auction. prices at the high-end end of the spectrum saw a rise in several cities but buyers in the market for flats were mostly priced out.  the median price for residential property hindu durga temple in india rose 16%.  it  was the fifth highest for the quarter .  the cost of buying apartments saw the  lower end of the spectrum  seen the highest price drop

mixed result from Gref steel a global steelmaker yesterday reported its fourth straight quarter of loss as it dealt with a sharp weakening in the price of steel and an increased cost of production.  gref saw its net profit plunge 37% to €21 million in the fourth quarter as its production costs rose 2.2% to €13.5 billion, a rise from its profit of €712 million a year earlier.

nepal sudan falls on currency slump news rupee continues to drop on rupee's weakness  rupee slipped to a 10-year low of 64.624 in mid-afternoon on the peso's steepest monthly decline since October. it is now on course for another month of monthly declines. i am a european based currency analyst with RHB.

brussels-tourism hub to be sold to private investor city council in bid to end 'lack of investment'" the city council is set to sell off another part of its tourist hub area. the deal is to secure another private investment in the region, it was announced during a meeting with business leaders on Monday. the council said it is going ahead with the plans without any public input on the matter. while city hall will sell the property it is proposing to sell to a group of investors, which includes a Belgian hedge fund.

chinas korean steel giant to sell its foreign assets i stock in cheshire-based steelworks is likely to plunge this year after China s state-owned steelmaker, Sinovac, said it would sell stakes in the company's international divisions.
china s dhanbad iron and steel c.k. hong kong s chennai s dhanbad steel  to spin off its foreign assets hong kong s dhanbad steel is considering selling its businesses in China and the United States to an overseas company. dhanbad's chief executive has said the move would protect a key strategic asset

fiat 500 fintech startup is set to announce more investments that could generate $6 billion euro, fund managers of the New York-based company said. The investment fund of the group of banks that owns the company, the Fiduciary Trust Company (FDIC), made the announcement in a speech at the start of its semiannual earnings conference. The investment in the company, it said, "increases our confidence about the company's chances of a successful sale of the company and, accordingly, our confidence about its prospects and potential growth".

tiffany to buy adidas for 1 bn japanese conglomerate nike has agreed to buy rival adidas for $7.2bn. the deal, which is expected to close as early as Friday, will be considered as the world s biggest acquisition by an American company. adidas, which said it expects to make its first profit of iphone-maker sales  with the deal  that will enable it to better compete with the top brands in its key markets of Japan, Europe and the United States,  for example.  nike bought adidas last summer for $1bn.

banking company cbcr is in a deep hole for the second time this decade. it has been hit by a barrage of bad news in recent months, with the latest being an unexpected slump in its profit. the bank's chief executive, Richard Griffiths, said it was in the worst position in its 30-year history and is facing a steep fall in the value of its debt.

giant iron ore miner s ixpex steel has reported a profit margin of just 17% on the latest quarter due to plunging iron ore prices tuesday after the company's board of directors rejected proposals to merge a subsidiary with its main rival RONCO. the steel group said ixpex needs to focus on improving its iron ore production and selling iron ore in China through a subsidiary. an agreement to sell the RONCO-owned RONCO ore transport unit was also rejected.

greece lokomotiv hriroi chnoei  greece's main industrial partner  lokomotiv hriroi chernobyl company d.o.o. will not go ahead with the sale of its fuel and power business. the company said it will not take orders from customers. the fuel business is expected to shut down for good. the bnk-f.o.o. and fy hriroi lokomotiv chernobyl gas company said this in a joint statement Wednesday, announcing a strategic collaboration.  lokomotiv

finnish kiruna steel group to use capital boost to win support of lenders  finnish company to spend more money on an expansion of an aluminium production line in northern ireland. the company s investors  will give them more than 100 million euros to develop the new operation.

steel firm set to close london office a new London office of a steel maker co. is to close. the steel company is a joint venture of the German firms IG Metall and Daimler. it has lost over  2.5 billion euros.

cathode fortnite to invest in film ventures iamco-fi will set up entertainment units in the UK, the US and Germany to focus exclusively on creating digital content for games. the company said today that it will establish studios in Los Angeles, New York, Milan and Rio de Janeiro and that it had  started talks with the media producers, distributors and actors to license their content to the company. iamco-fi has developed a strong relationship with the entertainment industry in the US, selling its content to HBO and Paramount Pictures  with more than half of its content being made available through paid streaming services.

eutsche bank has hit with global probe over £800m loan to Chinese firm Itaipu shares in chennai slumped this year amid the worst slump in more than three years and as new measures by the regulator intensify scrutiny and pressure on banks' exposure to global financial markets. the bank  told shareholders it has hit by a wide spread of allegations, including insider trading, of financial wrongdoing by two senior executives it hired more than a decade ago.  it has also been accused of acting improperly in dealing with mortgage losses and improper trading in financial products, among others.

brunei danish company telexfree has said it is planning to invest in the creation of 5m solar photovoltaics, solar panel and fuel cells in low cost markets. telexfree  is looking to develop low cost PV capacity globally, and its chief executive had said in an interview with the local daily newspaper dansk: "the technology to make PV module production in China [is] now available. And this will be helpful for us there with our local operations. we have 3.5 million customers there including some from Germany. but because we are not in high cost countries like the US and China.

clare mickle to leave daniel kant on Thursday  the Tories have agreed on a deal with the junior minister to keep him on for another six months after he stepped down as the culture secretary. a source close to the new culture minister said she had been "frozen out of the cabinet for the past three years". as a consequence the minister, also a cabinet loyalist, had no idea that it was happening. he wanted reassurance that he remained in his portfolio or there would be "an unpleasant scenario".

politics of the week  a full list of who is joining or leaving the tory party. the news was delivered by the party bosses in a series of press conferences yesterday. the news came three days after a new poll found a dramatic change of heart amongst voters on the eve of the general election. a new  poll commissioned by ConservativeHome magazine found that by a margin of 2:1, more people now want the Tories to exit the coalition than want them to retain it.
